project_overview.tagline: Privacy-preserving digital currency built openly by developers distributed all over the world

sources.note: Certificate expired, could not fetch directly

technology.description: Minimal implementation of the Mimblewimble protocol - a blockchain format and protocol that provides extremely good scalability, privacy, and fungibility by relying on strong cryptographic primitives

key_innovations.description: Privacy by default - no amounts and no addresses visible on blockchain
Transactions can be trivially aggregated, improving scalability and privacy
ASIC-resistant and ASIC-targeted mining variants using Cuckoo Cycle algorithm
Unlike many privacy coins, Grin requires no trusted setup ceremony
Transaction amounts are completely hidden using Confidential Transactions
Grin has no addresses - transactions use interactive exchange of blinding factors

sources: Web search results on Grin technology

team_and_governance.anonymity_note: Grin was created by anonymous developers. The real identities of Tom Elvis Jedusor (Mimblewimble author) and Ignotus Peverell (largest contributor) are unknown.

leadership.name: Ignotus Peverell
leadership.background: Primary developer of Grin implementation, identity unknown

leadership.name: Andrew Poelstra
leadership.background: BlockStream mathematician who improved Mimblewimble protocol and completed first whitepaper edition

leadership.name: John Tromp
leadership.background: Dutch computer scientist who contributed the ASIC-resistant secondary algorithm Cuckaroo29

team_and_governance.core_contributors_estimate: 10-15 active contributors with majority of commits

community_council.name: Grin Community Council (CC)
community_council.previous_council: Original Council (OC) - disbanded and merged into CC
community_council.governance_structure: Decentralized decision-making based on respect and trust
community_council.participation: Open to all, but voice carries weight based on community respect

team_and_governance.governance_philosophy: Not controlled by any company, foundation, or individual. Launched fairly without ICO, pre-mine, or founder's reward. Relies on donations.

community_funding.description: Community Council received 33 BTC for project development

developer_funding.description: Community votes to fund full-time developers through donations
developer_funding.historical_note: In 2019, community voted to fund third full-time developer

tokenomics.emission_schedule: Linear emission - 60 GRIN per block forever
tokenomics.inflation_model: Decreasing inflation rate over time (fixed emission, growing supply)
tokenomics.mining_algorithm: Cuckoo Cycle (dual algorithm: Cuckaroo and Cuckatoo)
tokenomics.asic_resistance: Mixed - Cuckaroo29 is ASIC-resistant, Cuckatoo31+ is ASIC-friendly
sources: Web search results on Grin tokenomics

related_repositories.name: grin-pm
related_repositories.description: Grin project management resources and docs

related_repositories.name: grin++
related_repositories.description: Fast, Private and Secure Grin Wallet (community project)

community_metrics.note: Specific metrics unavailable due to website SSL certificate expiration

milestones.description: Tom Elvis Jedusor proposed Mimblewimble protocol
Community-driven development of Grin implementation started
Grin mainnet launched with fair distribution
Grin Community Council (CC) formed, received 33 BTC funding

smart_contracts.note: Grin is a cryptocurrency, not a smart contract platform. No smart contracts.

security_gaps.reason: No formal security audit information found in available sources
security_gaps.note: Open-source code reviewed by community, but no formal third-party audit documentation found

security_and_audits.security_note: Grin relies on open-source community review and the Mimblewimble protocol's cryptographic guarantees. As a donation-funded project, formal audits may be limited.

privacy_features.description: All transaction amounts completely hidden using Confidential Transactions
Grin has no public addresses - interactive transaction protocol
Transaction aggregation breaks transaction graph analysis
Spent outputs can be pruned, improving scalability and privacy
Privacy is mandatory, not optional - all transactions are private

metadata.research_duration_estimate: comprehensive analysis with SSL access limitations
research_notes: Primary challenge: grin.mw SSL certificate expired, blocking direct access
Strength: Excellent GitHub repository documentation compensated for website access issues
Governance: Well-documented through forum and Medium article
Team: Intentionally pseudonymous founders (privacy-focused project culture)
Funding: Clear donation-based model with no VC, ICO, or pre-mine
Technology: Mimblewimble implementation thoroughly documented in GitHub
Privacy: Maximum privacy at protocol level - mandatory, not optional
